column1: '''Herendil''' was, at one stage in the writing of the [[Númenor]] myth, the son of [[Elendil]].<ref>{{LR
column2: P1}}</ref> His role was later replaced by [[Isildur]].

column1: A derisive name given to Herendul was '''''Terendul''''', meaning "Slender and Dark".<ref>{{LR
The name includes [[Qenya]] ''heren'' "fortune" and is translated by [[Tolkien]] with the [[Old English]] name [[Eadwine]].<ref>{{LR
column2: Etymologies}}, entry KHER</ref> Obviously his name means "Fortune-Friend".
